Chapter on Hells, Part 7
The bhiká¹£us who know the fruits of karma further contemplate the great hell of Burning Heat. What other places are there?
They see, hear, and know:
There is another place called Endless Submersion, which is the ninth separate place in that hell.
What karma causes sentient beings to be born in that place?
They see:
There are people who kill, steal, engage in sexual misconduct, drink alcohol, and tell lies, enjoying doing them and doing many of them. The karma and its fruits are as explained above.
Moreover, there is wrong view, with bodily, verbal, and mental actions, the karma universally pervading, the karma completed, and enjoying doing them and doing many of them.

Due to the causes and conditions of that evil karma, when that person's body perishes and their life ends, they fall into that hell and are born in the separate place of Endless Submersion, experiencing great suffering.
The so-called suffering is like the suffering experienced in the hells such as Saá¹ƒjÄ«va, which is fully present here five times more intense.
It is created by wrong views:
Due to incorrect hearing and being taught by others, one has this kind of thought:
'If one puts insects, ants, snakes, pythons, deer, or horses into the fire, since the fire is delighted, one attains great blessings and is born in a superior world.
Those burned by the fire are born in the world of MahÃªÅ›vara.
If a person burns sentient beings with fire, then one attains immeasurable superior great blessings.'

In this way, the foolish are deceived by wrong views and evil teachings. When the body of the person with wrong views perishes and their life ends, they fall into a bad place, are born in the different place of no end in that hell, and experience great suffering.
The so-called suffering is:

There is an iron mountain with flames burning fiercely and spreading for five yojanas. The mountain pervades the hell with fire. The Yama demons drive the hell beings up the mountain, burning their feet, waist, hips, back, arms, head, neck, hands, feet, ears, eyes, and even the brain. After being burned, they revive, and after reviving, they are burned again. The time is long and far, with no fixed number of years, until their evil karma is destroyed, rotten, and the energy of the karma is exhausted. At all times, they are given suffering without cease;
only when their evil karma is exhausted can they escape from that hell.

When those with wrong views escape from there, they are born among the ghost-spirits who eat feces for five hundred lifetimes, with all their body parts burning with flames, seen by many people when they walk at night.
Those evil karmic people, having escaped from such ghosts, are born among animals as fireflies, with flames on their bodies, seen by all people when they walk at night.
In the daytime, blown by the wind and scorched by the sun, the body burns inside.
This is the remaining karmic retribution of those evil deeds.
Furthermore, that bhiká¹£u, knowing the fruits of karma, contemplated again, 'What other places are there in the great Saá¹ƒjÄ«va hell?'
He saw, heard, and knew:
There is another place called MahÄpadma, which is the tenth separate place in that hell.
What karma causes sentient beings to be born in that place?
He saw:
There are people who kill, steal, engage in sexual misconduct, drink alcohol, and tell lies, enjoying doing them and doing many of them.
To put it briefly:
The actions of body, speech, and mind are universal and ultimate, and they are done and accumulated.

Due to the causes and conditions of those evil actions, when that person's body perishes and their life ends, they fall into a bad place, into that hell, and are born in the separate place of MahÄpadma. The karma and its fruits are as explained above.ğŸ”½Moreover, there is wrong view:
That person of wrong view has such thoughts:
'In the great fast, if one kills a man, one can obtain a satisfactory place.'

Having created such evil karma of wrong views, when the body perishes and life ends, one falls into a bad place, born in that hell in a separate place of large red lotuses, experiencing great suffering.
The so-called suffering is:
That hell place is like a red lotus, with vajra thorns in its stamens, five hundred yojanas long.

The hell offenders in the red lotus vajra thorns, those vajra thorns destroy all parts of their bodies, without a needle's worth of unpierced place, without a hell fire that does not burn everywhere, the body wounds burning with flames.
Thus for a long time, always burning and always boiling, until the evil karma is destroyed and rotten, the breath of karma is not exhausted, at all times giving suffering without stopping;
If the evil karma is exhausted, then in that hell place one can escape.
Having escaped from there, they are born among the excrement-eating hungry ghosts for two hundred lifetimes.
Having escaped from there, they are born among animals for five hundred lifetimes, becoming peacocks and so forth, always eating bad poison.
Having escaped from there, it is difficult for them to obtain a human body, like a turtle encountering a hole.
If they are born among humans in a place with the same karma, they are always impoverished and belong to others;
if they become entertainers, their livelihood is based on performing and they make a living that way. If they live like this, they are the lowest in the world until the end of their lives.
This is the remaining karmic retribution of those evil karmas.
Furthermore, the bhiká¹£us know the karmic retributions and contemplate the great hell of extreme heat again, asking: What other places are there?
They see, hear, and know:
There is another place called Evil Cliff, which is the eleventh place in that hell. What karma causes sentient beings to be born in that place?
They see:
There are people who kill, steal, engage in sexual misconduct, drink alcohol, and tell lies, the karma and its results are as explained above.
There are also those with wrong views who enjoy practicing and doing a lot, namely:
There are people who have such views:
'Those who drown themselves will have all their sins extinguished.
After death, they will be reborn in the world of the eight-armed one, where they will not fall back.'
Such a foolish person hopes to be reborn there, teaches others, and also rejoices in others drowning themselves and dying.
When that person drowns and dies, they fall into a bad place, into that hell of evil cliffs, and experience great suffering.
They destroy their bodily actions, verbal actions, and mental actions, and are born there to experience great suffering.
The suffering is as explained above, the suffering experienced in the hells such as Saá¹ƒjÄ«va, all that suffering is experienced there.
There is also something worse:

In that hell, extremely sharp blades fill the place, and there are many evil mountains, everywhere filled with steep cliffs and precipices, a thousand yojanas high, which even birds cannot reach, let alone sinful people who can go there.
Blazing flames are everywhere, burning intensely. A single hell-dweller in that hell says to all the other sinful hell-dwellers:
You should come here. Beyond this mountain, there is no more hell.
If you pass this mountain, we will attain happiness.
Because of their evil karma, the hell-dwellers hear and see that person speaking like this.
After speaking like this, the hell-dwellers rush to that mountain.

Due to evil karma, they arrive at that cliff, that dangerous shore. Everywhere there is burning, with raging flames. As they run towards it, they cannot climb up. Some fall down, some are burned to the extreme in the fire, some, out of fear, embrace burning rocks with their hands and are burned, some, out of terror, run back and forth seeking rescue and refuge.
The Yama demons there seize iron hammers and beat them relentlessly.

Those hell beings, due to their evil bodily, verbal, and mental actions, are burned and boiled for a very long time, until their evil karma is exhausted, rotten, and its energy dissipated. At all times they are given no rest from suffering;
only when their evil karma is exhausted will they escape from that hell.
Having escaped, they will be born among hungry ghosts who eat blood for three hundred lives, born in a place of the same karma.
Having escaped from there, for three hundred lives they are born among poisonous animals, which is the remaining karmic retribution of that evil karma.
If they are born among humans in a place with the same karma, they are poor and sick, born in a bad country with incomplete faculties, always in fear in a bad country.
Moreover, that bhiká¹£u, knowing the consequences of karma, further contemplated the great hell of Burning Heat, asking, 'What other places are there?'
He saw, heard, and knew:
There is another place called Adamantine Bones, which is the twelfth part of that hell.
What karma causes sentient beings to be born in that place?
He saw:
There are people who kill, steal, engage in sexual misconduct, drink alcohol, and tell lies, enjoying doing them and doing many of them, as explained above.
Moreover, there is wrong view, which they enjoy doing and do a lot. It is said:
There are people who think like this:

'All things in the world, whether living or not, are born naturally and perish naturally, like the thorns and needles, the colors of peacock feathers, like the mirage deer love, and the gandharva city, existing without causes and conditions, perishing without causes and conditions.
All dharmas are also like this, arising without causes and conditions, perishing without causes and conditions, naturally like this.'
He further teaches others and establishes others in this belief, destroying bodily, verbal, and mental actions.

Because of the causes and conditions of this evil karma, when that person's body perishes and their life ends, they fall into a bad place, into that hell where the bones are vajra, and experience great suffering.
The suffering is as previously explained, the suffering experienced in the hells such as Saá¹ƒjÄ«va, all that suffering is experienced there.
And there is more:
The Yama hell wardens seize the hell beings and use sharp, keen knives to scrape off their flesh, leaving only bones.
They see their former enemies holding skeletons and using them to strike each other.

Due to their evil karma, the bones become vajras. Some have their heads smashed, some have their bodies smashed, some sinners have all their limbs smashed, some have holes in their bones, some skeletons are dry, some sinners lose their limbs, some use bones to strike each other, and some are struck with flaming stones.
Due to the causes and conditions of their evil karma, for countless years, the hell beings in that hell see their former enemies holding each other and striking each other.
Until their evil karma is exhausted, rotten, and their karmic energy is not yet exhausted, they will always be given suffering without cease;
only when their evil karma is exhausted will they escape that hell.
Having escaped from there, they are born among hungry ghosts who eat their own brains for five hundred lifetimes.
Having escaped from there, they are born among animals for five hundred lifetimes, becoming scorpions, centipedes, or guá¹­as.
Having escaped from there, it is difficult for them to obtain a human body, like a turtle encountering a hole.

If they are born among humans in a place of similar karma, they are born in border regions, in countries with forests, in evil countries such as DhÄrakavÄ«ra and AndhradeÅ›a, poor and sickly, belonging to others.
This is the remaining karmic result of that evil karma.
Moreover, that bhiká¹£u, knowing the results of karma, further contemplated the great hell of Wailing and Screaming - what other places are there?
He saw, heard and knew:
There is another place called 'Cut and Sliced by Black Iron Ropes and Knives', which is the thirteenth place in that hell.
What karma causes sentient beings to be born in that place?
He saw:
There are people who kill, steal, engage in sexual misconduct, drink alcohol, and tell lies, delighting in doing them often, the karma and its results as explained above.
There is also wrong view, namely:
There are people who have this view:
'All good and evil are in causes and conditions, and wherever there are causes, there is good and evil.'
They delight in speaking of it to others, delighting in doing it often.

Because of the causes and conditions of this evil karma, when their body perishes and their life ends, they fall into a bad place, into that hell called 'Born in the Place of Suffering from the Cutting of Black Iron Ropes and Knives,' and experience great suffering.
The suffering is as explained above, the suffering experienced in the hells such as Saá¹ƒjÄ«va, all that suffering is experienced here five times more intensely.
There is also something worse, namely:
The Yama demons there bind their bodies with black iron chains. Due to their evil karma, they are thus bound and then cut open from foot to head with sharp iron blades whose flames burn fiercely.

The hell beings, having been bound and cut open, wail loudly, cry out, and weep. They are then bound again with iron chains, and the sharp, burning iron cuts them to the extreme, so that not even something the size of a mustard seed can be found, yet they are reassembled and revive again.
Having been reassembled, they are cut again, and having been cut, they are cut again.
In this way, the hell beings experience immense suffering for a long time, until their evil karma is exhausted, rotten, and its energy spent. At all times they are not stopped from suffering;
only when their evil karma is exhausted will they escape that hell.
Having escaped, they will be born among hungry ghosts for five hundred lifetimes, eating the dirty water discarded by people from their spittoons.
Having escaped from there, for one hundred lives they are born among animals, becoming leeches, scorpions, dung beetles, and various other insects. This is the remaining karmic retribution.
If they are born among humans in a place with the same karma, they are always oppressed by hunger and thirst.
If there are other people who violate the king's laws, they are falsely accused and unjustly pressed, causing them to enter into crimes.
This is the remaining karmic retribution of that evil karma.

There is another place called the Naga Insect Pillar of Suffering from Evil Fire, which is the fourteenth place in that hell.
What karma causes sentient beings to be born in that place?
They see:
There are people who kill, steal, engage in sexual misconduct, drink alcohol, and tell lies, enjoying doing them and doing many of them. The karma and its fruits are as explained above.
There are also those who enjoy and frequently engage in wrong views, namely:
There are people with such wrong views who say:
'There is no this world or the next, no killing, stealing, sexual misconduct, drinking alcohol, or lying, as explained above.
This world is eternal, and all phenomena are eternal, always indestructible.'
Those people have such inverted wrong views.

Those with wrong views further teach others to abide in wrong views, explaining them frequently and in large assemblies, explaining to others with evil causes and parables, causing those in front to take on evil wrong views.
In the great assembly.
In similar teachings, they explain the Dharma as non-Dharma.

Due to the causes and conditions of those evil actions, when that person's body perishes and life ends, they fall into a bad place, into that hell where the nÄga worm pillar and evil fire cause great suffering.
The so-called suffering is as previously explained, the suffering experienced in the hells such as Saá¹ƒjÄ«va, all of which are experienced here.
There is also a superior [suffering], namely:
There is an iron pillar there, piercing its head from below and emerging, like this emerging, half below the ground, half above the head.
Like this piercing, there are nÄga worms born in the skin, flesh, and fat of that sinner, eating everywhere on the sinner's body:
First pecking at the vessels, drinking the blood until it is exhausted;
Next eating the flesh, next breaking the bones, next drinking the marrow, next severing the sinews, next severing the vessels, next burning the orifices, next plucking out the hair, shaking the skin.
Next entering the body inside the bundles of sinews, next breaking the heart;

Next, with flaming tongs, they break open their jaws and pull out their tongues. After pulling them out, they give them to the dogs. This is because they originally spoke evil words, spoke inverted causes, and combined illegal analogies and explanations.
The hell beings suffer like this because of the sin of their tongues.
Those with wrong views teach others with distorted views, using extremely evil thoughts to convert others and make them abide in wrong views, destroying their bodily, verbal, and mental actions.
For a long time, they are constantly burned in hell, for innumerable years, until their evil karma is exhausted, rotten, and their karmic energy is exhausted. They suffer continuously at all times;

After escaping, they are born in the realm of hungry ghosts who eat corpses for three hundred lives.
After escaping from there, it is difficult for them to obtain a human body, like a turtle encountering a hole.

If reborn among humans in a place with the same karma, they will unjustly suffer the consequences when others violate the king's laws. Due to evil karma, they will be poor, sickly, bound to others, and lack independence. They will eat human flesh and still be called humans.
This is the remaining karmic retribution of their evil karma.

There are people who have such views:
'All dharmas are either permanent or impermanent.

That person of wrong views, with these two views, bad causes and bad similes, teaches others, causing them to abide in wrong views, and rejoices in it. In the great assembly, in that which is not the Dharma, he speaks of it as if it were the Dharma.

Because of the causes and conditions of that evil karma, when that person's body perishes and life ends, he falls into a bad place, into that hell called Darkness, Wind and Fire, and experiences great suffering.

In this way, as they spin like a wheel, a different wind of blades arises that shatters and cuts their bodies, reducing them to the size of sand balls scattered in the ten directions. They are then reborn again, and when reborn they are again scattered, and when scattered they are reborn again.

In this way, for an unknown number of years, they constantly experience such intense suffering until their evil karma is exhausted, rotten, and its energy spent. At that time, their suffering will not cease;

If one kills, steals, engages in sexual misconduct, drinks alcohol, and tells lies, enjoying it, doing it often, the karma and its fruits are as explained above.

Some people have this view:
'The world has a beginning. It arises from causes and conditions. It is both permanent and impermanent. Everything is created by causes and conditions.'

They speak falsely, with wrong reasons and similes, teaching similar dharmas within non-dharmas, causing other people to abide in wrong dharmas, regress from the right Dharma, obstruct the right Dharma and give rise to wrong views.

Their incorrect teachings say that the eternal Dharma is not a cause, the eternal Dharma is immovable, the eternal Dharma is unchanging, and the eternal cannot create, just like empty space. Those people with wrong views falsely discriminate.

They are lowly people, inferior among sentient beings.
They obstruct the right Dharma and abide in unwholesome dharmas.

Out of foolishness, they create the conduct of evil paths, considering themselves wise, relying on their wisdom to be arrogant, discriminating with their own minds, speaking falsely, and experiencing great suffering.

In this way, in the great hell of Burning Heat, in this way, the end of such places, the person of wrong views creates such karma, the abode of evil karma.

Their bodies are one yojana tall, extremely soft, softer than fresh butter. Their eyes are softer than their bodies. All five sense organs are extremely fragile and tender. Sound, touch, form, and smell can still kill them, let alone other sufferings.
As they commit evil, their evil karma is heavy, so their bodies and minds are all extremely fragile and tender.

Due to the power of their evil karma, those evil karmic people experience extreme suffering. When they are about to die, they experience the retribution of their present karma, and experience all the sufferings described in the previous Living Hell.

When such sinners are about to die, they experience suffering like this for three days before their life ends. Their voice is lost and they cannot speak. Their thoughts are greatly frightened. Their actions are weak and their consciousness is startled. In this way, the four great elements and form become angry, and they experience extreme suffering.

The earth element is hard and solid, the body is strong and angry, all parts of the body, sinews, blood vessels, bones and marrow are blocked everywhere, all are destroyed, and great suffering arises, like newly made butter, kneaded, pressed and beaten. The earth element is like this.
Moreover, the water element:

All parts of the body are bound by sinews and blood vessels, originally hard and dry, able to make them rot and slack, kill insects and make them smell bad, all the orifices are completely blocked, the throat is not smooth, the tongue shrinks into the throat, the orifices suffer, and sweat breaks out all over the body.
Moreover, the fire element:

All the sinews and blood vessels in the body are completely burned and cooked, suffering great pain, the skin of the body is the color of red copper, both inside and outside are hot, the mouth is very dry and thirsty, and the burning heart is blazing hot.
Moreover, the wind element:

The light symptoms increase, and because the body is dry, it is like ascending into the sky, and then falling back to the ground. All parts of the body are completely dry, and in all the blood vessels, the wind moves and does not stay.

There is a wind called piparika needle, which pierces like a burning needle, and spreads throughout the body like the roots of hair, and even the essence and marrow are completely dried up and burned.

The piparika wind can cut the skin, flesh, fat, bones, marrow, and essence, like an axe chopping, and blows on all the faculties, and all parts of the body are completely blocked. Excrement and urine are obstructed and do not pass through. The breath is not smooth, the throat is not right, the eyes are damaged, and the ears hear unpleasant sounds. The nose does not smell fragrances, the tongue does not know tastes, the nasal septum tilts over, the genitals retract, and the anus is painful as if touched by fire, and one suffers greatly. The skin swells up, and the hair falls out.
These are only said about evil-acting people who are about to die. Such people, for three nights and three days, have their four elements in a rage, and are afflicted by suffering and distress.

When their life is about to end, the signs of the next world appear. Namely, they see all houses like black tents, and see black flames. Like seeing colors in a dream, such evil signs never stay for a moment.

They also see unpleasant colors such as lions and tigers, and see all extreme evils in full. Hearing the evil sounds of tigers, they become greatly terrified. The iron mill grinds their skin, leaving only a little remaining.
That wind moves upward, starting from the toenails, leaving the toenails and moving to the feet;
leaving the feet and moving to the shins;ğŸ”½like this, leaving the shins and moving to the knees;
like this, leaving the knees and moving to the thighs;ğŸ”½like this, leaving the thighs and moving to the hips;
like this, leaving the hips and moving to the belly;
In this way, leaving the stomach, it moves to the heart;
In this way, leaving the heart, the throat becomes blocked, the mouth dries up, saliva is exhausted, one eye sinks in, and one sees Yama's men in the sky holding iron rods.
Having seen this, they touch it with their hands. Relatives and acquaintances, having seen this, all say this person is touching empty space.

Breath is blocked and blows all over the body. Then the breath stops, like a lamp burning out and extinguishing, leaving this world and being born in the intermediate state, like cause and effect being similar.

That evil person, in the intermediate state, experiences the suffering of the intermediate state. He sees his own body like a person of long life, with a lifespan of 84,000 years, the body of an eight-year-old child.

One sees one's own body, but no other person can see it. The four elements are subtle, unseen and unobstructing, able to penetrate and pass through Mount Sumeru without hindrance. One's own body does not obstruct Mount Sumeru, let alone other mountains.
In the intermediate state, one sees oneself entering a dark iron city.
Due to evil karma, one sees all the hairs on one's body ablaze.
One also sees the Yama demons binding one's hands and feet with black iron ropes.
Those black iron ropes are poisonous, hard to the touch, and terrifying in color.
They are then wrapped around the body, constricting it everywhere, not allowing even a hair's breadth of space.

Evil-acting people will see themselves thus, bound tightly by iron ropes, with unpleasant forms, sounds, smells, tastes, and tactile objects as their objects. That is to say, due to evil karma, they see unpleasant forms with their eyes, extremely frightening, with the eyes of the YamarÄja's men blazing with flames, many kinds of unpleasant forms, clenching their fists in extreme anger, their minds unwilling to look at them.
